chunks.en:
I stayed at Yonyou for 5 years, 2 years in project operation, and 3 years in sales operation support.
At the beginning of the year, Yonyou started a major layoff plan. There are many internal factions. If you stand on the wrong team, even if you get excellent employee performance, it feels useless.
The entire sub-industry is gone, and now I'm anxiously looking for a job and it's really difficult to adjust my mentality. I'm feeling depressed.
A lot of recruitment software doesn't reply.
Is there a chance to find something here?

Mainly, I have been doing project operation and sales support in tob software companies.
There are all developers looking for jobs here. I wonder if any company will pick up a small role like me?
Based in Shanghai.
If you answer the questions on the 1st floor, you will be at a disadvantage!
He's not recruiting anyway, and if you answer these questions, he'll just sneer at you.
Just honestly browse the recruitment software.
I feel it's an industry issue. The domestic tob industry is very poor.
@jasdkasdjkas Finding a job is really difficult. I have a few questions to understand: 1. What is your educational background? 2. What is your age? 3. What is your desired salary?

chunks.en: @jasdkasdjkas 1. Job search is either a friend or colleague recommendation, 2. Or browsing resumes in the open market and greeting others, waiting for the rabbit. If you feel your resume is OK, is there anything else that needs to be improved that you haven't noticed? 3. There is also a way to take the initiative and go directly to the door.
Switch to another sales job, such as selling Teslas.
You can switch to an industry with a future.
If you stare at your past experience and look for a related industry, you will face the same problems in a few years.
Or go to a related upstream or downstream industry and lie flat.
